name: Nicolas Guelfi
content: Nicolas GUELFI - FSTM - University of Luxembourg I Uni.lu Full professor Contact nicolas.guelfi@uni.lu (+352) 46 66 44 5251 Details Profile Profile CV Functions Full professor In detail Faculty of Science, Technology and Medicine Department of Computer Science Software engineering | Dependable systems Maison du Nombre6, avenue de la FonteL-4364 ESCH MNO, E03 0315020 nicolas.guelfi@uni.lu (+352) 46 66 44 5251 Publications on ORBilu Dr. Nicolas Guelfi is a Full Professor in Computer Science at the Departement of Computer Science of the University of Luxembourg. He joined the institution in 1999, contributing to the university’s creation and development. He was the founder of the Laboratory for Advanced Software Systems (LASSY), which he directed for over 10 years. He was the founding programme director for the academic Bachelor in Computer Science (BICS), which opened in 2017. Professor Guelfi has contributed extensively to the field of software engineering through publications, book editing, and serving as a program chair and review committee member. His research contributions have historically focused on: Requirements definition, specification, and simulation using formal, semi-formal, or informal methods. System dependability and resiliency. His current main research field is development methods for deep learning focusing on generative AI. Publication record overview can be accessed here: ‪Nicolas Guelfi‬ – ‪Google Scholar‬ Nicolas GUELFI | Professor (Full) | Phd | University of Luxembourg, Luxembourg | Research profile Current teaching duties include: Bachelor in Information technologies: Modeling with UML (S3) Master in European Governance: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence for the European Citizen. Master in Entrepreneurship and Innovation: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence for the citizen. Master in Entrepreneurship and Innovation: Artificial Intelligence for Entrepreneurship and Innovation. Master in Learning and Communication in Multilingual and Multicultural Contexts: Artificial Intelligence for Languages & Cultures. Professor Guelfi served as an expert for the Supreme Court of Justice of Luxembourg for 10 years (2007-2016), specializing in software conformance trials. He has also served as a member of the European Research Consortium in Mathematics and Informatics (ERCIM) executive committee. He has created an education offer in Artificial Intelligence, specifically Generative AI, aimed at supporting industry needs in up-skilling and re-skilling. This training is deployed at the Luxembourg Digital Learning Hub (DLH).
